VCS'S VERIFICATION

REPORT: ves version 3

Bureau Veritas Certification has made the Pre-CDM verification of Inner Mongolia Wengniute Banner Wudaogou Wind Power Project (Il), owned by Chifeng Xinsheng Wind Power Co., Ltd., which is located in Wengniute Banner, Chifeng City, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region,P.R.China, with UNFCCC Reference 3325 on the basis of Voluntary Carbon Standard (VCS) Version 3 Program, as well as criteria given to provide for consistent project operations, monitoring and reporting. UNFCCC criteria refer to Article 12 of the Kyoto Protocol, as well as the host country criteria.

The verification scope is defined as a periodic independent review and ex post determination by the Designated Operational Entity of the monitored reductions in GHG emissions during defined verification period, and consisted of the following three phases: i) desk review of the project design and the baseline and monitoring plan; ii) follow-up on-site visit and interviews with project stakeholders; iii) resolution of outstanding issues and the issuance of the final verification report and opinion. The overall verification, from Contract Review to Verification Report & Opinion, was conducted using Bureau Veritas Certification internal procedures.

The first output of the verification process is a list of Clarification Requests, Corrective Actions Requests, Forward Actions Requests (CLs, CARs and FARs).

In summary, Bureau Veritas Certification confirms that the Project is implemented as planned and described in the VCS-PD. Deviations from the monitoring plan are sufficiently justified. Installed equipment being essential for generating emission reduction runs reliably and is calibrated appropriately. The monitoring system is in place and the Project is ready to reduce GHG emission. The GHG emission reduction is calculated without material misstatements.

Our opinion relates to the Project's GHG emissions and the resulting GHG emission reductions viz. Voluntary Carbon Units (VCUs) reported are based on the valid project baseline, monitoring plan and associated documents. Based on the evidence and information that are considered necessary to guarantee that GHG emission reductions are appropriately calculated, Bureau Veritas Certification confirms following statement:

1 INTRODUCTION

1.1 Objective

Chifeng Xinsheng Wind Power Co., Ltd. has commissioned Bureau Veritas Certification to verify the emission reductions of the Verified emission reduction (VER) of Inner Mongolia Wengniute Banner Wudaogou Wind Power Project (Il) (hereafter referred to as “the Project’), which is located in Wengniute Banner, Chifeng City, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region,P.R.China for the period from 02/12/2008- 27/07/2010, prior to its first CDM crediting period.

Bureau Veritas Certification as the verification body of the Project has been accredited as a DOE by UNFCCC and also meets the competence requirements as set out in ISO 14065:2007.

Verification is the independent review and ex post determination by the verification body of the monitored reductions in GHG emissions during defined verification period.

Certification is the written assurance by a Certification Entity that, during a specific period in time, a project activity achieved the emission reductions as verified. According to the VVS, the Certification Entity is defined as an entity which has been accredited as a DOE by the CDM Executive Board for the particular scope into which the project falls or has been accredited as an approved Certification Entity by the VCS Steering Committee. Bureau Veritas Certification is an accredited DOE for the particular scope into which the Project falls.

The objective of verification is to verify and certify the Verified Carbon Units (VCUs) generated by the Project from 02/12/2008-27/07/2010.

VCS Version 3 Program and UNFCCC criteria refer to Article 12 of the Kyoto Protocol, the CDM rules and modalities and the subsequent decisions by the CDM Executive Board, as well as the host country criteria.

1.2 Scope and Criteria

The verification scope is defined as an independent and objective review of the VCS Project Description (VCS-PD), the Project's baseline study and Monitoring Report (MR) and other relevant documents. The information in these documents is reviewed against VCS Version 3 requirements, UNFCCC rules and associated interpretations.

The verification is not meant to provide any consulting towards the client. However, stated requests for forward actions and/or corrective actions may provide input for improvement of the Project monitoring towards reductions in the GHG emissions.

1.3 Level of assurance

The verification report is based on the VCS-PD, the VCS Monitoring Report (MR), CDM-PDD, supporting evidences made available to the verifier and information collected through performing interviews and during the on-site assessment. The verification conclusion is assured the level of assurance of the Project is high.

1.4 Summary Description of the Project

The Project is owned by Chifeng Xinsheng Wind Power Co., Ltd. (hereafter referred to as “the PP”) and is located in Wengniute Banner, Chifeng City, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region,P.R.China. The Project consists of 25 sets of wind turbine generators (WTGs) with a unit installed capacity of 2MW, providing a total installed capacity of 50MW. The annual expected electricity supplied to Northeast China Power Grid (NEPG) is 135,600MWh and the annual estimated emission reductions are 155,384tCOze.

The Project has been registered on 28/07/2010 (UNFCCC Ref. No. 3325) under approved CDM methodology ACM0002 Version 9 “Consolidated methodology for grid-connected electricity generation from renewable sources’.

The Project Start Date of the VCS Project is 02/12/2008, when the first wind turbine generator started electricity generation. The crediting period for the Project under the VCS is from 02/12/2008-27/07/2010.

2 VALIDATION PROCESS, FINDINGS AND CONCLUSION

2.1 Validation Process

The overall validation, from Contract Review to Validation Report & Opinion, was conducted using Bureau Veritas Certification internal procedures.

The Project Description (VCS-PD) ©! and the Monitoring report (VCS-MR) © submitted by Longyuan (Beijing) Carbon Asset Management Technology Co. Ltd. and additional background documents related to the project design and baseline, i.e. country Law, registered CDM-PDD Ae validation report, Approved methodology, Clarifications on Validation Requirements to be Checked by a certified validation body were reviewed.

Bureau Veritas Certification verified the information contained in the documents reviewed against the requirements set in VCS Standard Version 3.3 effective as the 01/05/2012" and the Clean Development Mechanism Validation and Verification Standard version 02.0), issued by CDM Executive Board at its 65" meeting on 25/11/2011.

In addition, on 01/09/2011, Bureau Veritas Certification performed an on-site visit and interviews with project stakeholders to confirm selected information and to resolve issues identified in the document review. Representatives of Chifeng Xinsheng Wind Power Co., Ltd. were interviewed (see References). The main topics of the interviews are summarized in Table 1.

3 VERIFICATION PROCESS

3.1 Method and Criteria

The overall verification, from Contract Review to Verification Report & Opinion, was conducted using Bureau Veritas Certification internal procedures.

The Project was verified against the requirements set in VCS Standard Version 3.3 effective as the 01/05/2012"! and the Clean Development Mechanism Validation and Verification Standard version 02.0 issued by CDM Executive Board at its 65" meeting on 25/11/2011.

3.2 Document Review

The verification of the project documentation provided by the project participant is based upon both quantitative and qualitative information on emission reductions. Quantitative information comprises the reported numbers in the monitoring report (MR) version 02 dated 20/08/2012 and VCS-PD version 3.5 dated 23/12/2009 submitted to the Bureau Veritas Certification. Qualitative information comprises information on internal management controls, calculation procedures, procedures for transfer of data, frequency of emissions reports, and review and internal audit of calculations.

In addition to the monitoring documentation provided by the project participants, Bureau Veritas Certification reviews:

a) The PD of the Project, the registered CDM-PDD, including the monitoring plan and the corresponding validation report! ®.

b) The applied monitoring methodology i,

c) Other information and references relevant to the project activity’s resulting emission reductions (e.g. national regulations) 2°! 2"),

3.3 Interviews

On 01/09/2011, Bureau Veritas Certification performed an on-site visit and interviews with project stakeholders to confirm selected information and to resolve issues identified in the document review.

Representatives of Longyuan (Beijing) Carbon Asset Management Technology Co. Ltd. were interviewed (see References).

3.4 Site Inspections

Please refer to section 3.3 above.

3.5 Resolution of Any Material Discrepancy

The objective of this phase of the verification is to raise the requests for corrective actions and clarification and any other outstanding issues that needed to be clarified for Bureau Veritas Certification positive conclusion on the GHG emission reduction calculation.

v3.1

VCS |S:

VERIFICATION REPORT. ves version 3

Findings established during the verification can either be seen as a non-fulfilment of criteria ensuring the proper implementation of a project or where a risk to deliver high quality emission reductions is identified.

Corrective Action Requests (CARs) are issued, where:

a) Non-conformities with the monitoring plan or methodology are found in monitoring and reporting, or if the evidence provided to prove conformity is insufficient;

b) Mistakes have been made in applying assumptions, data or calculations of emission reductions which will impair the estimate of emission reductions;

c) Issues identified in a FAR during validation or previous verification to be verified during verification have not been resolved by the project participants.

Forward Action Requests (FARs) are issued, for actions if the monitoring and reporting require attention and/or adjustment for the next verification period.

The verification team may also use the term Clarification Requests (CLs), if information is insufficient or not clear enough to determine whether the applicable VCS requirements have been met.

To guarantee the transparency of the verification process, the issues raised are documented in more details below.

4 VERIFICATION FINDINGS

4.1 Project Implementation Status

Bureau Veritas Certification has performed an on-site visit and found that the Project has been put into operation and the electricity generated is supplied to NEPG according to the signed Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) "7, 25 sets of WTGs (Model of Vestas V80-2000kW '"*!) with a unit capacity of 2MW, providing a total installed capacity of 5S0MW as described in the registered PDD have been in operation.

According to the implementation log of the Project "3 the Project has been commissioning since 02/12/2008.

No notification or approval of changes has been requested before for the Project. During the site visit, no changes from the project activity as described in the VCS-PDD, VCS-MR and registered CDM-PDD have been observed or identified. Hence there is no need to request for notification or approval of changes.

This is the first verification and there are no open issues from the validation report.

Information provided in the monitoring report is in accordance with that stated in the VCS-PD and CDM- PDD. Further analysis of monitored parameters as reported in the monitoring report compared to those estimated in the CDM-PDD is developed in section 4.2 of this report.

[Power System]

As shown in the diagram of the power connection system 4 the electricity generated by the Project is delivered to the Wudaogou 35kV/220kV substation and then delivered to NEPG.

[Metering System]

There are two meters installed for the Project.

The meter M1 and meter M2 have been installed in the two loops respectively at the transformer station which complied with the requirement of the registered monitoring plan. Both of them can measure the bi-directional electricity flows in each loop including exported to the grid and imported from the grid.

-

4.2 Accuracy of GHG Emission Reduction or Removal Calculations

(6] Monitoring has been carried out in accordance with the monitoring plan contained in the VCS-PD™ and the registered CDM-PDD “".

[Parameters and information flow]

The parameters required by the monitoring plan and the way Bureau Veritas Certification has verified the information flow (from data generation, aggregation, to recording, calculation and reporting for these parameters including the values) in the monitoring reports are described below:

Parameters monitored:

EG,, Net electricity supplied by the Project

v3.1

VCS |S:

VERIFICATION REPORT. ves version 3

The net electricity supplied by the Project is the electricity exported to the grid minus the electricity imported from the grid by the Project which is measured by the bidirectional meters. Therefore EG, can be calculated as below:

EG,= export - Eimport

As described above, the meters have been installed in accordance with the registered CDM-PDD and VCS-PD. The verification team has on-site checked the location of the meters against the diagram of power connection system and found them to be consistent.

The readings of the meter M1 and meter M2 in the two loops are hourly monitored and monthly recorded by the PP automatically by the computer system. 24:00 o'clock on the last day each month is the cut-off time to calculate the monthly quantity of net electricity generation supplied by the Project. The grid company provided the PP with the sales receipts monthly, which contain the electricity exported to and imported from the gird by the Project. For 0:00 02/12/2008 to 24:00 31/12/2008 and 0:00 01/07/2010 to 24:00 27/07/2010, separate sales receipts are issued by the grid company.

The verification team has verified the values provided in the monitoring report and ER spreadsheet against the relevant documented evidences i.e. the MRRs 2] and the sales receipts ™) and found them to be consistent with the evidences. The MRRs and the sales receipts can cover this monitoring period from 02/12/2008-27/07/2010.

Parameters determined ex-ante:

EF), emission factor of the grid

The emission factor of the crediting period of the Project has been determined ex-ante in the registered PDD ™! and VCS-PD ™. The emission factor of 1.1459 tCO.e/MWh used in the monitoring period has been verified against the registered PDD and found consistent.

[Calibration]

During this monitoring period, the installed metering equipments have been operating well and were duly calibrated. The calibration records are shown in Table 2 below.

4.3 Quality of Evidence to Determine GHG Emission Reductions or Removals

A complete set of data for the specified monitoring period is available.

The critical parameter used for the determination of the Emission Reductions is the net electricity supplied to the grid by the Project. The data pertaining to the above parameter are maintained in the identified records. All the data are in compliance with that stated in the Monitoring Report version 02.

As per the methodology ACM0002 Version 9 " and the VCS-PD ©, the emission reductions for the Project are calculated as the baseline emissions minus the project emissions. Hence the emission reduction is determined by the following formula:

ER, = BE,-PE,- Ly

Where,

ERy: Emission reductions

BE,: Baseline emissions

PE,: Project emissions

Ly: Leakage

[Baseline emissions]

The baseline emissions are the baseline emission reductions factor times the net electricity supplied to the grid. Therefore,

BE,= EF, x EG,

EF,: GHG emission factor of the NEPG, calculated ex ante in the registered CDM-PDD and VCS-PD as 1.1459 tCO2e/MWh

EG,: Net electricity supplied to the grid

The net electricity supplied by the Project (EG,) can be calculated as:

EG, = Eexport - Eimport

”!

The verification team has cross-checked the values from the MRRs with the sales receipts for the period from 02/12/2008-27/07/2010. The conservative values are used for emission reductions calculation. The verified values are shown in the following Table 3.

As per ex-ante calculation of the registered CDM-PDD, the average of annual emission reductions is 155,384tCO2e. The estimated ERs during this period are 282,810 tCOze (=155,384*684/365), whereas the actual emission reduction accomplished by the project during this verification period is 246,881 tCOze. Comparing with the estimated ERs, the actual ERs were lower than estimation.

4.4 Management and Operational System

The data reporting procedure between the Project and the grid company has been identified and assessed during the on-site visit. In order to ensure the completeness of the records of the meters, the PP had taken the effective actions including the installation, adjustment, calibration and continual monitoring for the meters.

v3.1

VCS |S:

VERIFICATION REPORT. ves version 3

The PP has operated the Project as per VCS-PD and the registered CDM-PDD. The monitoring organization has been set up, all monitoring staffs have been trained and quality control procedures are in place 6 271, Reading records of all meters are based on continuous measurement and are monthly recorded by the PP and the grid company. The grid company issues monthly sales and purchase receipts to confirm the net electricity supplied to the grid.

5 VERIFICATION CONCLUSION

Bureau Veritas Certification has performed the verification of Inner Mongolia Wengniute Banner Wudaogou Wind Power Project (Il), CDM Registration Reference Number 3325, owned by Chifeng Xinsheng Wind Power Co., Ltd., which is located in Wengniute Banner, Chifeng City, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region,P.R.China, and applying the methodology ACM0002 Version 9. The verification was performed based on the requirements set by VCS Standard Version 3.3 effective as the 01/05/2012, UNFCCC criteria for the CDM and relevant guidance provided by CMP and the CDM Executive Board.

The verification consisted of the following three phases: i) desk review of the project design and the baseline and monitoring plan; ii) follow-up interviews with project stakeholders and onsite visit; iii) resolution of outstanding issues and the issuance of the final verification report and opinion.

The management of Chifeng Xinsheng Wind Power Co., Ltd. is responsible for the preparation of the GHG emissions data and the reported GHG emission reductions of the project on the basis set out within the project Monitoring Plan in the registered PDD. The development and maintenance of records and reporting procedures in accordance with that plan, including the calculation and determination of GHG emission reductions from the Project, is the responsibility of the management of the Project.

Bureau Veritas Certification has verified the project Monitoring Report version 02 dated 20/08/2012 for the reporting period as indicated below. 1 INTRODUCTION

1.1 Objective

AKES has been commissioned by ‘AERA Group’ to perform verification of its registered VCS project ‘Soubré Hydropower Project’, for the reported GHG emission reductions for the given monitoring period 01/07/2022 - 30/06/2023 (both dates included). The VCS projects must undergo an independent third-party verification and certification of emission reductions as the basis for issuance of Voluntary Emission Reductions (VERs).

The objectives of this verification exercise are, by review of objective evidence, to establish that:

that:

e The project activity has been implemented and operated as per the project description (PD) and that all physical features (technology, project equipment, and monitoring and metering equipment) of the project are in place;

e Monitoring report and other supporting documents are complete;

e The data is recorded and stored as per the monitoring methodology and approved monitoring plan.

e To confirm that the monitoring system is implemented and fully functional to generate Voluntary Emission Reductions (VERs/VCUs) without any double counting, and

e To establish that the data reported are accurate, complete, consistent, transparent and free of material error or omission by checking the monitoring records and the emissions reduction calculation.

1.2 Scope and Criteria

The scope of verification is to assess the claims and assumptions made in the VCS monitoring report (MR) against the VCS criteria, including but not limited to, VCS standard, applied methodology and other relevant rules and requirements established for VCS project activities.

The Verification is not meant to provide any consulting towards the project participants. However, stated requests for clarification and/or correction actions request may have provided inputs for improvement of the project design.

1.3 Level of Assurance

The verification team verified the complete monitoring data /09/, /10/, /13/, /15/, /16/, /20/ and /23/ for all the monitoring parameters of the monitoring plan against the Monitoring report /1.2/ and ER Calculation sheet /2.2/ and confirms that the reported emission reductions are free from any type of material errors. Remote interview/Physical site visit was also conducted to verify the implementation and monitoring plan of the project activity. The implementation of the project activity (i.e. major equipment and the metering arrangement) was verified during the Microsoft Teams video conferencing/Physical site visit and found in accordance with the monitoring report /1.2/ and registered VCS PD /05/. Verification team has also verified the technical details of the project equipments and metering arrangement during the remote interview/physical site visit and also with the supportive document /09/ and /14/ and found

correct. Therefore, 4KES confirms that the verification is conducted with reasonable level of assurance.

The project activity is composed of a run-of-river hydropower plant with a capacity of 270 MW anda micro-hydro power plant of 5.35 MW generating capacity with a total estimated average gross electricity generation of 1,170 GWh per year, fed by a 17.3 km? reservoir. The plant is connected via three 225 kV transmission lines to the national grid: the transmission line Soubré-Buyo, Soubré-San Pedro and Soubré-Taabo. The technical specification of the turbines/alternators and the installed capacity of the project activity has been verified during the remote interview/physical site visit and also from the photos of the Turbines/alternators /09/.

The purpose of this project activity is to generate clean form of electricity and the net electricity generated from this project is supplied to the national grid via the transmission lines and PPA is signed between PP and the utility company /12/.

3.3 Project Description Deviations

[already formalized and approved at previous verification]

The technical details of Turbines/alternators installed under the project activity is different than the registered VCS-PD /05/. Section 3.2.2 of the MR /1.2/ has been filled accordingly. Verification team has verified the capacity of the project activity from the name plate photo of the turbines/alternators /O9/ and found consistent. The impact of the change in project capacity has been checked and verification team confirm that the deviation does not impact the applicability of the methodology nor the appropriateness of the baseline scenario. Since the change in the capacity is within 10%, which is already considered in the VCS-PD /05/ as part of the sensitivity analysis. Hence the deviation does not have any impact on the additionality of the project activity and project is still additional.

[identified in the current verification - although pre-existent]

Ex-ante emissions reductions were calculated based on an estimated ‘sold electricity’ average of 1,170 GWh/y * 0.9 (applying such 0.9 discount factor to conservatively account for auxiliary consumptions and losses from net power generation assumption of 1,170 GWh/y) at time of (CDM)PDD registration, which lowered expected emission reductions by 10%. However, such losses between gross power plant generation and delivery sub-station exports are actually less than 1%, and irrelevant to the emission reductions since already accounted in the net metered energy at substation anyway. Considering this change with respect to registered VCS PD /05/, section 3.2.2 of the MR /1.2/ is filled accordingly which is found OK. Corrections do not affect the scale, baseline or the additionality of the project and hence accepted to the verification team.

4.2.1 No Net Harm

The detailed environmental impact assessment was submitted to the Direction of Environment in February 2015 and approved by ANDE decree n°0078 of August 21st, 2015.

As of the latest update of the project’s Environmental and Social Management Plan (PGES, September 2019), its overall progress has exceeded 60% completion with on the one hand, the protection of biodiversity is effective with the creation of the a dedicated area of more than 200ha and the preservation of fauna and flora species, and on the other hand, the implementation of the development plan for the fishing industry in Soubré with, in particular, the training of aspiring fishermen, the organisation of the sector in Soubré and the start of construction work on the infrastructure.

The Resettlement Action Plan (PAR) has achieved its objectives with the restoration of impacted people's livelihoods. The construction of the resettlement sites with all the amenities of the urban areas and population displacements ended in 2018. Purge compensations of customary rights and destruction of agricultural crops have been carried out for all areas impacted by the dam.

Assessment of Data and Calculation of GHG emission reductions:

According to the approved methodology ACMOOO2, Version 16.0, Emission Reductions are calculated as follows:

Baseline Emissions

The baseline emissions are calculated as follows:

BEy = EGpuy * EFgria,cmy

Where:

BEy = Baseline emissions in year y(tCO2/yr) EGp, y = Quantity of net electricity genenration that is produced and fed into the grid as a result of the implementation of the VCS project activity in year y(MWh/yr) EF gria,cmy = Combined margin CO2 emission factor for grid connected power generation in year y(tC02/MWh)

Calculation of EGriy

Since the project activity is “the installation of a new grid-connected renewable power plant at a site where no renewable power plant was operated prior to the implementation of the project activity”, it verifies the case of a Greenfield renewable energy power plant of the ACMO002 methodology Version 16.0 whereby:

EGpiy = EGracility,y

Where:

EGpiy = Quantity of net electricity generation that is produced and fed into the grid as a result of the implementation of the VCS project activity in year y (MWh/yr)

EGracility,y = Quantity of net electricity generation supplied by the project plant/unit to the grid in year y (MWh/yr)

EGpiy (or EGracilityy) is an ex-post parameter and EFgriacuy is an ex-ante parameter which are justified above.

Where:

The project activity is a Grid connected wind power project implemented in Rajasthan, India. The project is promoted by “Orange Jaisalmer Wind Energy Private Limited” & “Orange Renewable Power Private Limited” of which the “Orange Renewable Power Private Limited” is the representative of this bundled project. 1 INTRODUCTION

1.1 Objective

EPIC Sustainability Services Private Limited (EPIC) has been contracted by Orange Renewable Power Private Limited to undertake the first periodic independent verification of the project activity titled “Bundled Wind Power Project in Rajasthan by Orange Renewable Power Private Limited”.

e To verify that the actual monitoring system and procedures are in full compliance with the system and procedures described in the monitoring plan of validated PD, version 2.0 dated 25-March-2015 as well as with the applicable methodology;

e To verify the monitoring report with deviations are in compliance with monitoring plan and VCS rules

e To verify that the data reported were accurate, complete, consistent, transparent and free of material error or omission by checking the monitoring records and the emissions reduction calculation; and

e To verify and certify GHG emission reduction reported for the project for the period from 31-March-2013 to 31-March-2015.

1.2. Scope and Criteria

The scope of the verification was the independent and objective review and ex-post determination of the monitored reductions in GHG emissions from ‘Bundled Wind Power Project in Rajasthan by Orange Renewable Power Private Limited’. The verification of this project was based on the validated and validated project description (PD)'*”, validation report®” and supporting documents made available to the verification team. These documents were reviewed against the requirements of the VCS standard version 3.5, VCS guidelines, the CDM Modalities and Procedures, related rules and guidance, and the VCS Validation and Verification manual Version 3 4/82)

The verification is not meant to provide any consulting towards the client. However, stated request for clarifications and/or corrective actions may provide input for improvement of the project design.

1.3. Level of Assurance

In line with VCS requirements and as per ISO 14064-3:2006 para A.2.3.2, a reasonable level of assurance is defined for the verification of the project. This implies that based on the process and procedures conducted EPIC should state whether the information in the monitoring report is materially correct and is a fair representation of the actual project details, and is prepared in accordance with the VCS requirements and the applied CDM methodology for information pertaining to additionality, GHG quantification, monitoring and reporting.

2.5 Resolution of Findings

Resolution of Clarification and Corrective Action Requests The objective of this phase of the verification was to resolve the corrective action requests and clarifications and any other outstanding issues which needed to be clarified prior to EPIC’s verification conclusion on the monitoring report. During the verification process ten CARs and one CL were raised.

All the CARs and CLs were resolved during this phase. In order to ensure the transparency of the verification process, the concerns raised and responses that were given are summarized and documented in more detail in Appendix 1. All the corrective actions have been incorporated into the monitoring report.

A Technical Reviewer is appointed to review the final draft verification report and the final verification report. The comments made by the Technical Reviewer are taken into consideration and incorporated in the final report. The final report (after resolutions of all findings) is then submitted to the Head —Operations for review and approval

No Forward Action Request (FAR) is raised in this verification process. Also no FAR was raised in the validation report® which needs to be addressed during the verification.

4.3 Quality of Evidence to Determine GHG Emission Reductions and Removals

The only monitoring parameter in the project is Quantity of net electricity supplied to the grid during the year y (EG facility). The monthly calculation of net electricity by the project WTG is done by project developer (Suzlon or ReGen) based on the project site metering (PSS energy meter for OJWEPL or controller for ORPPL) and government substation (GSS) bulk metering and the same is provided in the share certificate. All the monthly EG facitiy,y data is crosschecked with the JMR & share certificate” . As per Power Purchase Agreement (PPA), the same net generation data provided in the monthly share certificate is used for billing. Hence the data is also cross-checked with the monthly electricity invoices” and found to be correct. Since the data considered for ER calculation is same as the data used for billing, the data considered is appropriate.

As mentioned in the VCS Project Description, the calibration is not within the control of project proponent as it is the responsibility of respective state DISCOM. It is also the minimum requirement as per host country rules based on the Central Electricity Authority (CEA) notification on 17-March-2006, that the calibration of the billing meters is atleast once in 5 years. Hence as no clear frequency was established by the state monitoring agencies, using the criteria as per CEA regulations, the calibration validity was assessed and the requirements were fulfilled as per information indicated below:

5 VERIFICATION CONCLUSION

EPIC Sustainability Services Private Limited has been engaged by Orange Renewable Power Private Limited to perform the first periodic verification of the VCS project “Bundled Wind Power Project in Rajasthan by Orange Renewable Power Private Limited” for the period from 31 -March- 2013 to 31-March-2015.

The verification was based on the validated PD, the baseline and monitoring methodology, validation reports, emission reduction spread sheets and other supporting documents made available to EPIC verification team by the project participant. The management of project proponents are responsible for the preparation and reporting of GHG emissions data, and the reported GHG emissions reduction on the basis set out within the project monitoring plan.

It is the responsibility of EPIC verification team to express an independent GHG verification opinion on the GHG emissions from the project for the monitoring period starting from 31-March- 2013 to 31-March-2015 and on the calculation of GHG emission reductions from the project based on the verified emissions for the same period.

The verification was carried out in accordance with the requirements of the VCS Validation and Verification manual Version 3.1 and VCS Standard 3.5. As a result of the verification, the verification team confirms that for the reporting period:

e the project is implemented as described in the validated PD except the deviations mentioned in section 2.2.2 of MR,

e the monitoring plan is in accordance with the approved monitoring methodology applied by the project activity except the deviation mentioned in section 2.2.2 of the MR.

e the deviations in the project deception & monitoring plan are not significant which does not impact applicability of methodology, baseline and addtionality of the project

e the monitoring has been carried out in accordance with the validated PD version 2.0 dated 25-March-2015.
